javadoc:
Model for the {@link ExtensionTablePanel}. This defines 5 columns for displaying information in {@link ExtensionDetails} objects: 

 		- Installed (checkbox)
 		- Name
 		- Description
 		- Installation directory (hidden)
 		- Archive directory (hidden)

All columns are for display purposes only, except for the installed column, which is a checkbox allowing users to install/uninstall a particular extension.

Constructor.
@param serviceProvider the tool providing the extensions table

params.name: serviceProvider
params.comment: the tool providing the extensions table

Overridden to handle the case where a user has toggled the installation column
 checkbox.

methods.name: isValidVersion
methods.comment: Returns true if the extension version is valid for this version of Ghidra.

return.comment: true if extension version is valid for this version of Ghidra

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the model has changed as a result of installing or uninstalling an extension.
@return true if the model has changed as a result of installing or uninstalling an extension.

methods.comment: Returns true if the model has changed as a result of installing or uninstalling an extension.

return.comment: true if the model has changed as a result of installing or uninstalling an extension.

Replaces the table model data with the given list.
@param model the list to use as the model

methods.javadoc: Gets a new set of extensions and reloads the table.
methods.name: refreshTable
methods.comment: Gets a new set of extensions and reloads the table.

methods.name: getSelectedExtension
methods.comment:
Returns the selected extension. 
 
 Note that this table is single-selection only, so this will only
 ever return 1 item.

return.comment: the selected extension, or null if nothing is selected

name: ExtensionTableModel
comment:
Model for the ExtensionTablePanel. This defines 5 columns for displaying information in
 ExtensionDetails objects:
 
 
 		- Installed (checkbox)
 		- Name
 		- Description
 		- Installation directory (hidden)
 		- Archive directory (hidden)
 
 
 All columns are for display purposes only, except for the installed column, which 
 is a checkbox allowing users to install/uninstall a particular extension.

fields.javadoc:
We don't care about the ordering of other columns, but the install/uninstall checkbox should be 
	 the first one and the name col is our initial sort column.
fields.name: INSTALLED_COL
fields.comment:
We don't care about the ordering of other columns, but the install/uninstall checkbox should be 
	 the first one and the name col is our initial sort column.

fields.javadoc: This is the data source for the model. Whatever is here will be displayed in the table.
fields.name: extensions
fields.comment: This is the data source for the model. Whatever is here will be displayed in the table.

fields.javadoc: Indicates if the model has changed due to an install or uninstall.
fields.name: modelChanged
fields.comment: Indicates if the model has changed due to an install or uninstall.
